numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a general tendency.
2. Young women reach out to a parent more often than young men.
3. The graph includes text messages.
4. The graph includes video chats.
5. The graph includes phone calls.
6. The graph includes in-person visits.
7. In every aspect in the graph, young women reach out more than young men.
8. The rate of text messaging is higher for young women than for young men.
9. The rate of calling is higher for young women than for young men.
10. The difference in the rate is about 40 percentage points for text messaging.
11. The difference in the rate is about 40 percentage points for calling.
12. The rate of in-person check-ins is equal for young women and young men.
13. About 20% to 25% of young women use in-person check-ins.
14. About 20% to 25% of young men use in-person check-ins.
15. I wonder why young men reach out at lower rates than young women.
16. I wonder why young adults use in-person reaching out very little compared to other forms.
17. This graph relates to my community.
18. This graph relates to me.
19. Most people in my inner circle have ages that are shown in the graph.
20. Many people in my inner circle are young men.
21. Young men are almost twice as likely as young women to not reach out to their parents.
22. This fact is a slight concern for me.
23. I want to know why my young male peers are reluctant to reach out to their parents.
24. I want to know why my young male friends are hesitant to reach out to their parents.
25. The headline is: What is your form of communicating with your parents?
26. The headline is: Do you do it at all?
